FuncDef:
The port-queue-template command applies a port-queue template to an interface.
The undo port-queue-template command deletes a port-queue template from an interface.
By default, no port-queue template is applied to an interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a port-queue template.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, the question mark (?) and space not supported.

Specifies the outbound direction of an interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a network is congested, to ensure that service packets in the queues of a high priority, such as VoIP packets and video packets, are preferentially scheduled, run the port-queue-template command. After packets enter the queues on an interface, the interface schedules packets based on the port-queue template.
Prerequisites
A port-queue profile has been created.
Precautions
The port-queue command and the template configured using the port-queue-template command are mutually exclusive on an interface.
